ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Computer Question
ygData.msgSnippet: I honestly don t know. I ve never used or seen it used in a configuration like that before. I ve used it with dialup and DSL before, only. You might want to
ygData.messageBody:
I honestly don't know. I've never used or seen it used in a configuration
like that before. I've used it with dialup and DSL before, only. You might
want to google for their homepage....I can't think of the URL...and go
check.
----- Original Message -----
From: Su <suceress@...>
To: <EverQuest@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, September 30, 2003 7:46 AM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Computer Question


> Would Sygate work for 5 computers to share a satellite connection that has
> to be connected directly to a computer via usb port and run the ISPs
> software? I used Windows Network Setup Wizard to establish my network. It
> leaves much to be desired. The computers all run WinXP Home edition.
> luv,
> -Su
>
>
> > Yes. I have 5 on a single connection, myself. One is directly connected
to
> > the DSL, and runs a program called Sygate which shares the connection to
> the
> > other machines. It has a special configuration package for EQ, but
worked
> > fine without it, for me, so try working without it first. If you have
any
> > trouble with it, email me, it has a few rare but known issues that can
be
> > hard to diagnose but are pretty easy to fix.
>
>
>
> Visit the EverQuest homepage at http://www.everquest.com
>
>
> Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/
>
>
>
